Posts.Content: LAFinFIT wrote: Hi Everyone, I am a bit confused and needless to say concerned. In Sept of 2011, I went to a new gyn (to follow up on a previous issue) as I had just moved. She decided to do a full exam (to include) breast as I was a new patient to her. To my surprise she felt a "mass" at 2 o'clock on my left breast and referred me for a mammogram-(which lead to an US) and a breast surgeon for follow up. The surgeon reviewed the diagnostics and said she didn't see anything on any report or feel anything and i was "triple negative" and not to worry. BUT come back in 6 weeks to follow up. Now i do believe she was a new doc because when i tried to make the f/u they didn't have her as part of the practice and they would have to call me when they got her sched. I do not know if she was new in medicine or the practice though. I do have a family hx of breast cancer and I am of complete european decent (supposedly it puts you at higher risk). Long story short- they never called to schedule and i think due to my uncertainly with this surgeon i had not followed up with them. I did follow up with my gyn again and she clearly feel's this "mass". I felt it after she pointed it out (both visits) as well. I don't want to speculate- but with a "mass" and hx but not seeing anything i am unable to feel "safe" so to speak. Do i request a biopsy or just go with the confirmation by the doc? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I want to be happy but i can't- Triple Negative-Am i safe? LAFinFIT LAFinFIT

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 07:17AM LAFinFIT wrote: Yes Beesie that is what she meant. I agree the terminology was rather odd (now that i know what it really means in terms of BC). Since posting I got a new referral to a different practice and have an appt mid Feb. Thank you all for your input; it's much appreciated!
Posts.Title: I want to be happy but i can't- Triple Negative-Am i safe? LAFinFIT LAFinFIT

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2012 11:44AM LAFinFIT wrote: Thank you, Marie! I am glad you said that because really that is what brought me to this site. I was searching for "triple negative results" and I was shocked!! It appeared a bit odd to me as well. I even called my husband to confirm that was the term she used. I often think we need to listen to our instincts, however, sometimes we need that "yeah, you should".. thank you again!
